treatment.description: Plants 0.2–0.7(–1) × 0.5–2 m. Leaves: petiole 2–5 mm; blade 0.1–1.5 × (0.4–)0.5–0.8(–1.3) cm. Inflorescences 1–4(–6) cm; bracts (2–)5–12(–17) mm. Peduncles (0.1–)2–6(–7) mm. Involucral bracts 1–2 × 0.4–0.6 mm. Flowers: perianth 1.8–4 mm; filaments 1–2 mm; anthers 0.2–0.3 mm. Achenes 2–3(–3.5) mm. 2n = 40.
treatment.discussion: Dedeckera eurekensis is known from small, disjunct populations along the western slope of the White Mountains from southern Mono County southward into the Last Chance Mountains of Inyo County.
